instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No usb ports
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no water damage.
both the usb ports don't work, but keyboard and trackpad works which is funny. I put in a usb stick. i'm getting 5v .275v and 3.1v on the pins. so its getting voltage, but not popping up in disk utility

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No usb ports
threads.message:
Usually L4600/10 problem
Rip them off and solder direct wires.
You may also need to remove and bypass <CHIP>U4650</CHIP> too.
Also compare diode mode to ground on both P/N data lines with similar board.
